p: Anosmia and Ageusia, the prevalence of anosmia and ageusia ranges widely in different studies from 5% in a study from China [ 39] to about 88% in an Italian study [ 56]. Smell impairment was also reported in SARS-CoV-1 and influenza infections. [ 27] Anosmia was reported in 3730 patients out of 28 studies in the case of SARS-CoV-2. ( Table 3) In COVID-19, anosmia is typically not accompanied by nasal swelling or rhinitis and based the findings of several studies it is an important common early clinical presentation even in the absence of other respiratory symptoms. [ 209] several studies reported that anosmia was more common among females, younger and non-hospitalized patients. [ 211, 214] In most patients, anosmia went away on its own within 3 weeks. [ 211]
